latestVersion.disclaimer: Code is provided without any warranty.

fields.value: Differentiating biological colours with few and many sensors: Spectral reconstruction with RGB and hyperspectral cameras

dsDescriptionValue.value: This Dataverse holds supporting data for the paper "Differentiating biological colour with few and many sensors: Spectral reconstruction with RGB and hyperspectral cameras" by Garcia, Girard, Kasumovic, Petersen, Wilksch and Dyer 2015.  The data consists on: a) non-linear RGB TIFF images; b) linearised version of images in a) stored as 3888 x 2592 x 3 matlab matrices where monochrome images corresponding to the red, green and blue colour channels are stored along the thrid dimension of the matrix, following Matlab's standard format for RGB images; c) A Matlab files directory containing a matrix (.mat) file storing linear RGB values for the calibration set and reflectance spectra readings corresponding to each sample in the set. This data is required for the spectral reconstruction of any given RGB combination. Code for performing the spectral reconstruction mentioned in the paper is also provided as a plain, txt file. Copy and paste the contents of this file into a matlab function page for creating the function in your own machine. d) An excel file containing the data in c) for reference purposes.  The authors provide the code without any warranty. Please refer to the publication for more details.

fields.value: Garcia, Jair, Girard, Madeline, Petersen, Phred, Dyer, Adrian

Images were recorded using a calibrated Canon EOS 40D and correspond to the colour samples available in the Munsell Book of Colour Matte Collection and an X-rite Digital ColorChecker SG. Targets were illuminated by a Broncolor HMI Mercury discharge lamp.   Reflectance spectra from the target colour pairs and the calibration set were measured within a 390 to 710 nm interval with an USB 4000 Ocean Optics spectrophotometer connected to a ISP-50-8R-GT integrating Sphere (Ocean Optics). The halogen l
amp of a DH-2000 light source (Ocean Optics) was used as illumination source.
Spectral data was collected using standard colorimetric procedures.
Spectrophotometer, Hyperspectral camera, RGB digital camera

files.description: Linearised versions of the calibration set saved as Matlab matrices (.mat). Each linearised image consists on a 3888-by-2592-by-3 array where images corresponding to the red, green and blue collar channels are stored along the matrix's 'third' dimension.
files.label: Linearised_images_munsell_matlab_matrices_1.zip

dataFile.description: Linearised versions of the calibration set saved as Matlab matrices (.mat). Each linearised image consists on a 3888-by-2592-by-3 array where images corresponding to the red, green and blue collar channels are stored along the matrix's 'third' dimension.

files.description: Matlab function script for reconstructing spectral signal based on a set of calibration samples of known, linear RGB values and corresponding reflectance spectra.
files.label: metamer_reconstruction_code.txt
